text: ajlaporte: Could you explain your use case a bit more? First thing that comes to mind would be assigning every item in contents to a JS variable (using loop.index to name them), but I’m trying to figure out what you might want to be using the loop for if you don’t want to show anything in the first place.

Going with what I was askign about above, I was able to get a choice field to be set using a variable that is appended to using a for loop. Only issue is now everytime the for loop completes the appending, it outputs true
I'm trying to stop the update from outputting true
ah, my bad, let me review that

kind of random, but how often do the authors change? I’ve done something similar with a choice module and a blog listing, but what I did was assign each blog post to a HubL variable in a “varaibles.html” file, then imported them into the custom module. Let me go through and see if I can post the choice module part.
Does HubSpot allow for the `{% do ----- %}` statements in Jinja?
I haven't tried it before, but generally if there is something that ins't in the documentation I try it anways to see if it works.
yea, i tried it, just wasn't sure if there was an alternate command for doing it
